intro: Sapium veracruzense, commonly known as the Veracruz cupuaçu, is a tropical plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces a fruit that resembles a cupuaçu, which is edible and has a sweet, creamy texture. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often cultivated for its fruit and ornamental value.
